greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 1, =  number of cells of area k/t^2 in generation n of Jim Conant's iterative dissection of a square, where t = 2^ceiling(n/2).
comment: This tiling is described in A328078.  At generation n, the construction requires that each edge of the square be divided into t = 2^ceiling(n/2) segments. Then 1/t^2 is the area of the smallest possible region at generation n.
example: Start of triangle (the rows are labeled by n = 0,1,2,... and the columns by k = 1,2,3,...):
4,3,2, (See the illustration for n=4: there are 4 regions of area 1/16, 3 of area 2/16, and 2 of area 3/16.)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 13 2019
